unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about bloating after eating dal-chawal, huh? Classic Indian digestive drama! Look, even my Nani, who could digest iron nails (probably), used to complain sometimes. It’s not just you, bhai!
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about bloating after eating dal chawal, huh? Classic Indian digestive drama! Look, even my Nani, who could digest iron nails, probably, used to complain sometimes. It’s not just you, bhai!

unnormalised: Firstly, you gotta consider what *kind* of dal. Moong dal is usually chill, but that urad dal? Hoo boy, buckle up. Plus, how much ghee did your mom (or you, no judgement!) throw in there? Ghee is delicious, no doubt, but too much can make your stomach feel like a bloated rickshaw stuck in traffic. It's the Mumbai monsoon of your gut, basically.

unnormalised: Then there's the rice. White rice can be a sneaky culprit. Brown rice might be your new best friend. Think of it like upgrading from a scooter to a Royal Enfield – takes longer to digest, but handles the road better. Also, chawal ke saath papad? Spicy pickles? Adding fuel to the fire, my friend!

unnormalised: And let's be real, are you gulping down that Thums Up or Limca with your meal? All those fizzy drinks are basically inflating your stomach like a balloon at a birthday party. Stick to chaas or water; your stomach will thank you. I’m not a Dr. but this is from experience.

unnormalised: Finally, walk around a bit after eating. Don’t just collapse on the sofa like a beached whale watching Bollywood. 10-15 mins of gentle strolling can do wonders. If it persists, though, maybe see a proper gastroenterologist. Could be more serious than just too much dal-chawal. They might suggest tests, and you don't want to ignore a persistent issue. Good luck and may your stomach be ever in your favour!
